title: Improvements based on improvement proposals
body: PR based on improvements specified in https://github.com/hyperledger/composer/issues/3130﻿ # Changes made ## General - Changed vehicle-lifecycle naming to vehicle-manufacture - Configured applications for running in iframes ## Installer - Updated references to vehicle-lifecycle-network business network to be vehicle-manufacture-network - Updated flows.json to remove previous Node-RED implementation and replaced it with a solution that listens for an UpdateOrderStatusEvent and sends and email if status is updated to delivery, the user paul has an email set and the user of the demo has configured the send email node. - Added install for using fabric v1.1 which installs against composer @next - Install now listens for an environment variable of DEMO_FABRIC_VERSION if unset it defaults to fabric 1.0 and composer @latest, if set to hlfv11 it uses fabric 1.1 and composer @next ## Car builder - Updated config to include reference to the REST server details - Updated app.js to return the JSON config unless the environment variable REST_SERVER_CONFIG is set with the REST server details. - Updated building screen to show tick when selecting trim and extra options - Updated building screen to prevent submission without filling in trim, colour and interior details for the car - Updated building screen to submit PlaceOrder transaction to REST server - Updated PlaceOrder request format to reflect changes in the business network - Updated status screen to listen to websockets coming from the REST server ## Manufacturing - Updated config to include reference to the REST server details - Added app.set to server/app.js that stores value from config file or if set the environment variable REST_SERVER_CONFIG - Updated websocket in server/app.js to prevent app death on disconnection from remote and set it to use the config set so that it listens to the REST server for events - Removed vehicles and transactions endpoints. - Added orders endpoint to retrieve PlaceOrder transactions using the REST server and combine with retrieved UpdateOrderStatus transactions to handle that order assets no longer store an array of the updates placed on them - title: Vehicle Lifecycle demo doesn't work properly due to failures inside Node-Red
body:
This is the error you see in node red
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/25582377/31767116-cd0bc3c2-b4c1-11e7-8cce-c2c903f2002b.png)

This occurs for 2 reasons
- A bug in the fabric-node-sdk that writes back to their credentials store
- permissions and uid usage from sharing a single file system across disparate docker containers. docker containers see this as a local file system to write files based on their uid, gid, umask etc. but these uid values won't match those defined in another docker container or even match the user who is logged in. This kind of directory/file sharing is probably only safe if each container is built from the same linux base and the users defined to each container are consistent (ie all exist and have the same uid/gid).

participant Insurer extends Company {
}

title: npm install fails for non-localhost docker
body:
If you don't have docker running directly on `localhost` (eg if you're communicating with a virtual machine, using [docker-machine](https://docs.docker.com/machine/overview/), etc) then the `npm install` step will just wait infinitely at the `while ! nc localhost 7051 </dev/null; do sleep 1; done` step.

If those references are changed, the following error will occur later in the install process:

```
...
Written Business Network Definition Archive file to digitalPropertyNetwork.zip
Command completed successfully.
Deploying business network from archive digitalPropertyNetwork.zip
Business network definition:
	Identifier: digitalproperty-network@0.0.1
	Description: Digital Property Network
events.js:141
      throw er; // Unhandled 'error' event
      ^

Error
    at ClientDuplexStream._emitStatusIfDone (/home/fabric-sample-applications/packages/getting-started/node_modules/grpc/src/node/src/client.js:189:19)
    at ClientDuplexStream._readsDone (/home/github/fabric-sample-applications/packages/getting-started/node_modules/grpc/src/node/src/client.js:158:8)
    at readCallback (/home/github/fabric-sample-applications/packages/getting-started/node_modules/grpc/src/node/src/client.js:217:12)
```

There doesn't appear to be any way around this via configuration as it's hardcoded in a number of places, but here's how to get it to work:

1. replace the three instances of `localhost` with your docker host IP (eg, `192.168.99.100`) in `scripts/start-hyperledger.sh`
1. remove/comment out the `rm -rf ~/.composer-connection-profiles/defaultProfile/*` line in `scripts/download-hyperledger.sh`
1. create a `~/.composer-connection-profiles/defaultProfile/connection.json` file with the following content, replacing `<DOCKER_IP>` with your docker host IP (eg, `192.168.99.100`) and `<HOME_DIR>` with the absolute path to your home directory (eg, `/Users/michael`):

```json
{
  "type": "hlf",
  "membershipServicesURL": "grpc://<DOCKER_IP>:7054",
  "peerURL": "grpc://<DOCKER_IP>:7051",
  "eventHubURL": "grpc://<DOCKER_IP>:7053",
  "keyValStore": "<HOME_DIR>/.composer-credentials",
  "deployWaitTime": "300",
  "invokeWaitTime": "100"
}
```

Now `npm install` (and a subsequent `npm test`) should succeed.

Not sure whether this should be documented, or the startup scripts modified to accept an env variable of some sort – but if anyone else runs into it, hopefully they'll see this issue.
